p: Transmission was primarily person to person through infectious droplets that occurred during coughing or sneezing, through personal contact (shaking hands), or by touching contaminated surfaces. SARS-CoV-2, SARS and MERS coronaviruses are thought to have originated from bats and transmitted to humans from an intermediate host, civets and dromedary camels, respectively. For SARS-CoV-2, the zoonotic source and intermediate host is not confirmed yet and research is going on [ 2].The mean incubation period is about 5 days, ranging from 1 to 14 days and 95% of patients are likely to experience symptoms within 12.5 days of contact. However, asymptomatic carriers have been reported and the incubation period is 19 days, making it even more challenging to screen the infection [ 3].
